title: Two police officers stabbed at service station in Toronto near Newcastle in NSW
text:
Two police officers have been stabbed before opening fire on a man at a service station south of Newcastle in New South Wales.

The officers were attacked after being called to a service station in Toronto at about 1pm following a report of a man armed with two knives.

Police opened fire on the man but missed after they were stabbed. One officer was stabbed in the leg and the other suffered knife wounds to their hand.

A 25-year-old man was arrested.

The officers were attacked after being called to a service station in Newcastle at about 1pm following a report of a man armed with two knives

Both the officers were taken to John Hunter Hospital for surgery. They are both in a stable condition.

A group of men witnessed the incident while traveling on a bus on their way to perform community service.

'I had got out of the bus to get some air when this bloke focused on me and said: 'where is my ounce, where is my ounce',' one of the men, Joel Roberts told the Daily Telegraph.

'I thought "what is this bloke on about" and then I saw the knife in his hand.'

Mr Roberts and a number of other people ran to Toronto Police Station where they alerted officers to what they had seen.

He said the police weren't armed with tasers, and used a baton to try and disarm the man before he stabbed one in the thigh and the other one in the hand.

The officers then took out their guns and fired several shots before the man dropped his knife, but was uninjured in the scuffle.

'Myself and two others ran in and grabbed the bloke and held him on the ground until other cops arrived,' Mr Roberts said.
description: Two police officers have been stabbed before cops opened fire on a man at a service station south of Newcastle in New South Wales.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
